instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 Reprogram BIOS
threads.message: Just wondering if someone could possibly post detailed instructions/parts needed to reprogram 820-3662 BIOS??

threads.title: 820-3662 Reprogram BIOS
threads.message: Get a TL866A and an adapter for the chip, use software to read from the chip.

threads.title: 820-3662 Reprogram BIOS
threads.message: the issue is i have an adapter meant for 100mm that i buy from sunkee on amazon, and the bios chips are almost always 150mm. so i tape over the heatsink pad of the bios chip so that it will fit on the adpater without shorting out all the pads.. and linking you to that would be really dumb, since i am doing it with the wrong adapter

threads.title: 820-3662 Reprogram BIOS
threads.message: I purchased a TL866A, however can I also purchase a preprogrammed chip too?

threads.title: 820-3662 Reprogram BIOS
threads.message: 3662 boards have a normal SOIC chip not like on the Air models. I'm still trying to find a clean ME that will work with these....

threads.title: 820-3662 Reprogram BIOS
threads.message: Can I just purchase a preprogrammed chip on Ebay??
